properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 12 at 10:56AM EST until February 16 at 12:48AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh PA
properties.description:
...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in
Pennsylvania...

Ohio River At Pittsburgh affecting Allegheny County.

.The Flood Advisory will continue through Saturday despite a brief
fall below action stage Thursday morning. Additional rainfall will
cause the river to rise back above 18 feet Thursday afternoon.

The Flood Advisory continues for
the Ohio River At Pittsburgh.
* Until late Saturday night.
* At 10:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 18.9 feet.
* Action stage is 18.0 feet.
* Flood stage is 25.0 feet.
* Forecast...After a brief fall, the river is expected to rise with
the anticipated rainfall tonight. The river will crest at 19.5
feet Friday morning.
* Impact...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the Monongahela
Parking Wharf.
* Impact...At 19.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the north shore
riverwalk between the stadiums.
* Impact...At 19.5 feet, The Mon Parking Wharf is completely flooded.
* Impact...At 20.0 feet, Water is up to one foot deep in the lower
areas of the North Shore Riverwalk.
properties.instruction:
This Flood Advisory means river flows are elevated.  Heed any road
closures.

Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz .

NWSheadline: The Flood Advisory is now in effect until early Sunday morning
